title: Which course is best after 12th commerce without maths? - Quora

response.answer_text: I answered a similar question . This is a copy paste from that answer. Commerce is a vast field . There are numerous courses and therefore you’ve plenty of options to choose . Some of the major courses are as follows : BCOM (bachelor of commerce) - under this , you’ll be provided with good fundamental knowledge of accounting , economics , taxation ,statistics ,cost accounting and finance . BCom (professional studies)- this is a unique program wherein you can pursue professional studies (such as CA,CMA,CS,CIMA,CFA) parallel with your bcom program . BCom(BPM - INDUSTRY INTEGRATED) - this program is designed to facilitate students to conveniently pursue careers in the IT industry as well as in other sectors like banking ,insurance ,financial service, retail business etc. BCom( Travel and tourism ) BCom (professional -international accounting and finance)- this program has been designed in collaboration with Assiciation of Chartered Accountants (ACCA) BCom (Analytics) BCom LLB - this is an integrated course consisting of five years . Upon completion of your BCom course you’ll be pursuing a degree in law . BBA (Bachelors in business administration )- this course helps to build a base in core business disciplines . You’ll get an opportunity to explore different functional areas of a business environment. BBA(Entrepreneurship ) BBA (professional - finance and accountancy ) BBA LLB BMS (bachelor of management studies) - this course provides theoretical and practical training which helps to inculcate leadership and managerial skills . BCA (IT and Software) if you’re into programming then this is the most suitable course for you . BFA (Bachelor of financial accounting) Besides the commerce related courses , you have the option to pursue various other art courses such as: BA in humanities and social sciences BA in Arts BA LLB Bachelor of journalism BSC animation and multimedia B.F.D. And many more I have only covered a few Major career options , hopefully this helps. Go ahead with what makes you feel happy, good luck :)

Hello, There are lots of careers available in commerce without math’s .  Since you have taken PE as a subject, are you willing to go ahead and make it a profession. You may support it with other certificates or courses like Alternate healing, yoga, aerobics, Dietitian and so on. But as far as the regular courses are concerned, after 12th, you could opt for the following courses: B.Com: a regular 3 years undergraduate course, whereby you would be exposed to general subjects like Accounts, Book Keeping, financial management, statistics and so on.Post B.Com you could opt for M.Com or MBA or courses like Taxation, financial markets and stocks, banking etc.BBI: Bachelors in Banking and insurance. This is a self financed course for 3 years. The fees for these courses are higher than the regular courses. These are application and practical oriented courses. This course would make you eligible to work in banks and insurance sector, though banks conduct entrance exams for recruitment.BFM: Bachelors in Financial Markets: This is another 3 years Self financed course. This course would make you eligible for the stock markets and their dealings and other financial related matters.BMS / BBA: A 3 years undergraduate management program, whereby you would be exposed to basic management ideas. BBA is a Pune University course, but it is more practical oriented course.BMS: A 3 years Media related course. This course exposes you to basic media functioning like Journalism, Advertisement, and Public Relations.Designing: A 4 years undergraduate course in Designing, which would expose you to the basics of designing. You could choose from specializations like Interior, Fashion, Product designing and so on...Choices are many. Here you would have to decide whether you have the required skills to survive in an industry. Hope this answers your query. Wish you good luck..
